feasibility_check.conclusion: POD CAN capture temperature fields mathematically, but the approach is fundamentally unsuitable for this problem.

result: ABORTED - POD not viable for this problem due to sample-specific physics
key_findings: POD requires pre-computed snapshots from the SAME physical system
Each sample has unique physics (kappa, bc, T0) - no universal basis possible
Building sample-specific POD during optimization requires simulations - defeats purpose
Temporal fidelity (40% timesteps) already provides similar speedup (2.5x) without this complexity

pod_approach.implementation: Complex - requires snapshot collection, SVD, coefficient mapping
pod_approach.fatal_flaw: Each sample has different physics - can't pre-build universal basis
